Compute time lag by earth scale.
Er, one, er, forty, er. Computer reading one five earth minutes, reducing.
We are close behind them.
Success! Success!
Exterminate!
Success!
Final victory inevitable!
Order executioner to prepare to disembark.
I obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki gives Barbara a bar to eat.

Dialogue.Line: What flavour is it?
Guava.
Oh, it's useless, useless.
Hello, hello. Got our battle dress on again?
The Doctor doesn't seem to be having much luck.
No. Well, if we can't escape from them, we'll have to stay and fight them.
But we're in front. We could keep moving.
Yes, but for how long, Vicki?
Let's ask the Doctor. He should know by now what he's going to do.
Ah, I'm afraid it's no good. I'm quite unable to elude them.
Doctor, what are we going to do when we land? Just wait for the Daleks to catch us up?
It takes twelve minutes for our computers to re-orientate and gather power. Now, that twelve minutes is vital to us. We must hold onto it. Give me time to be able to do something whereby
Why don't we just go faster, Doctor?
Yes, well, please, just leave it to me, dear boy, just leave it to me, will you?
Doctor, the time rotor. Doctor, it's slowing down.
Oh, that means we can land in two minutes.
But where, Doctor, where?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tourists are getting the tour.

Dialogue.Line: Here on top of the Empire State Building, you're on the hundredth and second storey above the ground level. At a height of one thousand four hundred and seventy three feet. This is the tallest building, the tallest structure in the entire world. Now you'll note, when you come up in the elevator, it took you seven minutes. Well, this way down, you wanna get down in a hurry, it would take you thirty seconds.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: laughter

Dialogue.Line: Well, of course, we don't recommend that. Now as we gaze out across the panorama. As we gaze out across the imposing panorama of our proud city, you will notice many other notable buildings. Among them the Chrysler Tower, that's one thousand and forty six feet high, and the Chanin Tower, that's six hundred and eighty feet high and already it's threatened with obsolescence.
(cowboy hat and camera) With ob what?
Observe also the mighty Hudson river and now if you'll come with me to the north aspect of the building, I will point out many more items of interest.

The Tardis materialises.

Dialogue.Line: We sure don't have anything like that in Alabama! No sir, ha!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He turns to follow the tour group, then.

Dialogue.Line: I could have sworn that thing wasn't there just now? Well, I guess that's New York for ya! Ha!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara comes out of the Tardis.

Dialogue.Line: Morning.
You're from Earth.
No, no, Ma'am. No, I'm from Alabama.
What time is it?
Three after twelve, Ma'am.
I really meant what year is it?
What, you mean you have different years here?
Well, what year is it in Alabama?
1966 Ma'am. Say, you wouldn't be trying to have a bit of fun with me now, would you?
No, no.
Afternoon.
Mornin'. 1966.
Oh, er, thank you.
Pleased to oblige you, Miss!
I recognise this place. It's Ancient New York.
Ancient?
There were pictures of it in our history books. It was destroyed in the Dalek invasion.
Wait, how many more of you are there in that thing?
Oh, just the four of us, young man.
Must be a kind of tight squeeze. They can't all have come out of there.
Doctor? This is no place to meet the Daleks. A lot of innocent people could get hurt.
Yes, quite so, quite so, dear boy. Well, the computers will be ready in a few moments. I suggest that we re-embark.
Yes.
Vicki, Barbara, come along.
Hey, you goin' back in?
Yes, that's right.
Oh now, come on, wait a minute. I just bet you folks are from Hollywood. You're making some kind of motion picture. Now that's it, ain't it?
No, it ain't! I mean, it isn't.
Come on, you can tell me. Your secret will be safe. Yes, sir, real safe.
Secret?
Sure, I've seen this trick before. Great long police cars comin' outa tiny little wooden sheds. I saw you come outa there with ma own eyes! You just ain't gonna make it back it again.
Goodbye.
Goodbye!
Goodbye!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Morton slaps the Doctor on the back.

Dialogue.Line: Hot diggety! I knew I was right. You should be wearing Police uniforms, you all is, you all is in a chase.
Chase? Yes, as a matter of fact, young man, that's exactly what this is. Now, if you'll excuse me, I must be getting along. It's the chase, you know?

Sure thing, Mister! I understand. Just wait til I tell the folks back home I met some real live movie pe... (knocks on Tardis door) Do you know Cheyenne Bodie? Look, just wait a minute, I want to get this thing on celluloid.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis dematerialises.

Dialogue.Line: That's real clever, how they done that. Sure if it don't beat all.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek's ship materialise.

Dialogue.Line: Sure is clever. Gol darn it if they ain't gone and done it again.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Dalek comes out.

Dialogue.Line: Howdy, Mister! Say, you sure are an ugly looking friend. Wait, what's the name of this film, Mister? My, my, boy, you've come all over in blue spots. What's this thing here?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He grabs the Dalek's ray gun and gets pushed against the wire mesh for his troubles.

Dialogue.Line: Now, just, now now! There ain't no need to get sore. The other movie people was right friendly.
Movie pe? Where are they?

They just left. They was in some kind of beat-up old blue wooden box. It just kinda like vanished. Say, I thought they'd have been chasing you. Just hold it there, Mister. I want to get a picture of this.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek ship dematerialises.

Dialogue.Line: Sure is the greatest...

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But he's missed the shot again.

Dialogue.Line: Well, dang me if they ain't gone and done it again. This is the greatest thing. It's gotta be around here somewhere. Just can't vanish into thin air. I know you're there somewhere, boy.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Morton starts feeling the air and stamping on the floor as the group returns

Dialogue.Line: I enjoy my work gives me a chance to meet people. You know. I get around
There's gotta be a trick to it somehow! Yes, sir, I bet this here's hollow. That's what it is.
He's a nutter. Keep an eye on him. See that he don't jump off the building. I'll get a cop. Watch him.
Coming back. They should
Yes, I wonder.
They're still on our track.
Catching us up, are they? Will you get my screwdriver, child? The large one. The one that I was fiddling with on the Visualiser.
Okay.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian and Barbara carry a piece of equipment in.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, this thing's heavy.
Yes, thank you, thank you.
Is this going to work, Doctor?
Maybe, I'm not sure. But if they're going to catch us up, we've got to find something to fight back with.
Oh, Doctor, why don't we just stay where we are?
That's out of the question, my dear. The vacuum in space, we should all be dead in no time.
Here you are.
Ah, thank you, thank you.
What's this all about?
Well, the idea is, my dear, is to find something that we can fight back with.
Doctor, we're landing!
But I'm not ready! I'm not ready! We can't meet them now! Oh, good gracious! No, wait a minute. We shall have to land and then take off as quickly as we can again.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A two-masted brigantine with an American crew, at 5 bells.

Dialogue.Line: (Albert C, ship's mate) Land about six miles off to the south south west, sir.
(Benjamin S, Captain) Aye, that'll be the island of Santa Maria. One of the Azores group. We're making poor time, Mister Richardson. And now it becalmed, after the storm.
I'll mark a reading on the deck log, sir.
I'm going below if you should want me. Sarah says our child has sickness.
Oh, I'm sorry to hear about that, sir.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis materialises.

Dialogue.Line: It is a ship, Ian. It's a sailing ship at sea.
Barbara, don't go wandering off, please.
I just want to have a look. I love sailing ships.
There's no point in being seen.
No, well, I'll just have a look over the ship's rail.
No, no, the Doctor's at the controls, we're

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian goes back inside.

Dialogue.Line: Got you!
Oh, let go of me! Let go of me!
No, you don't, my beauty! Captain Richardson's got a way of dealing with stowaways.
I am not a stowaway and you're hurting my hands!
Just you keep still. Where've you been hiding since we set sail, eh?
I haven't been hiding. I have just come on board!
Oh, I suppose you're some sort of a mermaid that's lost at sea, eh? You swam out from Santa Maria there just to give us poor lonely sailormen a little bit of feminine company, eh?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki sees the struggle and grabs a weapon.

Dialogue.Line: Well, everything appears to be in order, my boy.
Oh, we haven't done very well so far, Doctor, have we? Let's face it. First of all, we land on top of a skyscraper, now we land on a crummy old ship. What we need is space.
Indeed, indeed. Well, we're ready to move on. Now, would you tell the ladies that I want to get away, please.
Yes.
Thank you.
Barbara's got a case of call of the sea.
Ah, I'm sorry about that too.
You're hurting my hand! Look, even if I told you the truth, you wouldn't believe me.
I believe what I see. Now, come along! You're going before the Captain!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki knocks him out.

Dialogue.Line: Well done. Thanks, Vicki!
That's all right. Any time.
Hey, there's somebody coming. Hide!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It's Ian.

Dialogue.Line: Oh.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian gets hit on the head too.

Dialogue.Line: Got him! I got him!
Yes.
Oh!
Vicki! Vicki, quickly!
Oh! Oh, Ian, I'm terribly sorry! Did I hurt you?
Oh, that's a silly question! Come on, let's get him into the ship.
Oh, Ian. I didn't mean it! Oh, Ian.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Richardson wakes, and the Tardis dematerialises.

Dialogue.Line: Captain Briggs! Captain! Captain Briggs!
Yes, Mister Richardson?
Captain, there was a thing. It was on the lower deck.
What are you talking about?
A stowaway, sir. She got away from me.
A stowaway, eh? A girl?
Aye, sir.
Mister Bosun! Pipe all hands amidships. We've a stowaway.
Aye, aye, sir!
How'd she get away?
I got hit over the head.
By her?
No, sir, it couldn't have been, because I was holding her arms. Do you think it was the white Barbary terror?
That's ungodly superstition, Mister Richardson.
We've more than one stowaway aboard, Mister Bosun.
Aye, sir. The storm must have bought them out of their hiding place.
Aye, lad. I want them found. Each watch can take a section of the ship and search it thoroughly.
I'll take the forward hold, sir. Mister Bosun, take Starkey and Willoughby, search up aft.
Starkey, Willoughby.
And Bosun, I'll thank you not to disturb my wife and child.
Aye, aye, sir. The rest of youse men search the hold. Keep your hands off the cargo.
We shall soon be arriving. Order the search party to stand by.
They are ready.
Is that where the humans have landed?
Yes. Join the search party and prepare to disembark. We are materialising now.
There's nobody here, Willoughby.
We'll try below.
The white terror! The white terror of Barbary!
Where are the time travellers?
Run, lads! Tis the white terror! Run, run!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Panic, and they jump overboard to get away from the Dalek, including Mrs Briggs carrying her baby.

Dialogue.Line: Fools! Get back to your posts!
Get away!
Wait.
Get away!
Do not move. Answer my question.
Come on, sir, come on! Come on. It's the Barbary terror! Come on! You're not going to take my soul.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Richardson jumps.

Dialogue.Line: Sarah!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Briggs takes off his jacket and dives in.

Dialogue.Line: Is the earth time machine here?
It has not yet been discovered.
Join in the search.
You search up there.
No, no!
Wait!
No, no, no, no! Please! No! Please! No! No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: And he jumps overboard too. A Dalek also goes over the side by mistake.

Dialogue.Line: There is no one on the vessel.

Dialogue.Line: I'm not wild about this place.

Dialogue.Line: Argh! Look out!
Probably vampires, if you ask me.
Oh, charming.
Oh, rubbish my child. Vampire bats are only to be found in South America.
Maybe that's where we are.
No, I don't think so. Judging by the architecture, I should say Central Europe.
Well, I'm with Barbara. I don't like it here. I think we should go.
Yes, in the normal progress of time, my dear, I would say, I would agree with you, but unfortunately we've got to face the Daleks and I think it's essential we take a look around. Let's try upstairs.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A creak of a stair and a loud sound of bat wings.

Dialogue.Line: Well, you got if you want to, but I'm staying near the Tardis.
Me too.
Oh, very well, stay where you are. We shan't be long.
Shan't be long.
Well, Vicki, there's really nothing to be scared of. This is just an old house. We mustn't let our imaginations run away with us.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Thunder.

Dialogue.Line: No, you're quite right. We mustn't behave like children.
No, we mustn't. Now come on, let's help the Doctor and look around down here. How about the fireplace?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The mantle is carved to make it look like an open mouth. When they get close two stones revolve to look like eyes. They sidle away and find a wooden case.

Dialogue.Line: Look at that. What do you suppose is inside it?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara goes to open it and there is maniacal laughter. She gets the lid open and it is empty. They laugh with relief. Barbara closes the lid and a skeleton drops down in front of them. Screams!

Dialogue.Line: What was that?
Oh, it's just thunder, dear boy.
No, no, no, the noise before that.
Oh, rubbish, there was no noise before that. Come along, come along.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: An image of a girl passes through Ian.

Dialogue.Line: What have you found now?
Well, it looks like a laboratory to me. Look at all that equipment down there.
Doctor, I think we'd better check on Barbara and Vicki.
Oh, nonsense. We've only just left them, dear boy. Now, I must see what's on that table.
Must you? I'd really rather not know.
You don't mean that, do you? Where's your spirit of adventure?
It died a slow and painful death when those bats came out of the rafters.
Very well, then, stay where you are. Stay where you are.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Frankenstein's monster rises from his slab and the Doctor retreats back up the stairs to the landing.

Dialogue.Line: I say, I think we'd better check where Vicki and Barbara is!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The monster stretches out his arms and Ian follows quickly. The monster lies down again.

Dialogue.Line: What's that in aid of?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara quotes John Donne.

Dialogue.Line: And therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls: it tolls for thee. Vicki, I feel as though my hair's turned white.
It has as a matter of fact.
What!
It's all right though, it quite suits you.
Oh, Vicki!
Good evening.
Good evening.
Who are you?
I am Count Dracula.
But you can't be, I mean, not, not really.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The figure goes back behind a door.

Dialogue.Line: He's gone. Thank goodness for that anyway.
Vicki, do you think there's something strange going on around here?
Oh. no.
Why did he go away so quickly?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She tries the door.

Dialogue.Line: Well, I can't seem to open it from this side. Vicki, do you supp .

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But Vicki's disappeared.

Dialogue.Line: Vicki? Vicki, where are you?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A White Woman on the landing screams something unintelligible. Barbara backs up against the wall and it turns, taking her away. She screams, of course.
The Doctor and Ian are stumbling along with only the light of a small torch to guide them.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, there's one thing about this place, Doctor. It certainly stimulates the phagocytes. The phago? You know, it's uncanny, strange and weird, but it is familiar.
Yes, that's the word, dear boy, familiar. You know, when I was coming down those stairs, I knew that thing was going to move. I knew it.
Oh, did you? I didn't notice you standing around to check your premonition.
I never stay where I'm not wanted. Come along.
Pre-conditioned. That's it. Pre-conditioned!
What are you talking about now?
This house is exactly what you would expect in a nightmare. Yes, we're in a world of dreams. Creaking doors, thunder and lightning, monsters and all the things that go bumpety bumpety in the night.
With one vital difference, Doctor. This house is real. It exists.

Yes, yes it exists in the dark recesses of the human minds. Millions of people secretly believing. Think of the immense power of all these people, combined together, makes this place become a reality.
Then we're safe.
Safe? What on earth do you mean, dear boy?
But the Daleks can't touch us here? Not in the human mind.
You know, I believe you're right. Yes! The Daleks can never land here!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They go down the stairs, pausing at the creaky one at the bottom.

Dialogue.Line: The girls have gone.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor checks in the Tardis.

Dialogue.Line: Vicki? Barb? Perhaps they followed us upstairs?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: So Ian and the Doctor go back upstairs as the Dalek Machine materialises.

Dialogue.Line: The enemy time machine is here. We have caught them.
Which planet are we on.
Earth. They only changed their geographical and time location.
This time they will not elude us. Already the search force is disembarking.
Search. I shall remain here in case they return.
Where are those girls, Doctor? Well, we would have seen them if they were upstairs. Hadn't we better take another look down there?
Had we?
Afraid so.
Well, after you, dear boy.
No, after you. Wait for me.
Shh! Someone's coming.
Take cover.
Where are the time travellers?
The time travellers? They're

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian drops a grill in front of the Dalek. The monster rises from his slab.

Dialogue.Line: Do not move.
The Tardis, quick!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian and the Doctor get out of the room.

Dialogue.Line: Do not move. I am a Dalek.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It shoots the monster, but it does not stop it.

Dialogue.Line: We are invincible.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The grill goes up and Frankenstein's monster attacks the Dalek.

Dialogue.Line: Stop! Stop! Ahh!
Oh, there you are!
Vicki.
Where have you both been?
We climbed through a secret tunnel straight down
There's no time to tell us now. The Daleks are here.
Daleks?
Yes.
Look out!
Halt! You will be exterminated.
Good evening.
Quick, into the Tardis while we've still got a chance!
Look out, he'll kill you! You'll be killed!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek shoots Dracula.

Dialogue.Line: I am Count Dracula.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki is trapped by Daleks as the Tardis dematerialises.

Dialogue.Line: Eradicate her.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The monster arrives, now dressed in a suit instead of bandages, and starts to rip the top off a Dalek.

Dialogue.Line: Obliterate.
I am Count Dracula. Don't go. Don't go. Don't go. Don't go. Don't go.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The monster throws a Dalek across the room, the White Woman wails, and the Dalek's weapons have no effect on any of them.
Vicki runs into the Dalek time machine.

Dialogue.Line: Embark at once.
At once!
Yes! Embark!
Embark! At once!
Embark! Embark! Embark! Embark!
This game of hide and seek through time is wearing a little thin now.
Game?
What an extraordinary place? More spooks to the square mile than the Tower of London. You know that theory of yours
Theory, my dear boy? Fact. I am convinced that that house was neither time nor space. We were lodged for a period in an area of human thought.
And were the Daleks lodging too?
Oh, I don't want to enter into it. A discussion with him! Oh!
Have it your own way. I think there's a much simpler explanation.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A ticket booth by the House says 'Festival of Ghana 1996, cancelled by Peking, Frankenstein's House of Horrors, price 10 dollars.
Later.

Dialogue.Line: Well, how's this box of tricks coming along, Doctor?
Oh, necessarily crude, dear boy. I haven't time to perfect anything.
When's it going to be operational, eh?
You know just as much about that as I do.
Oh Doctor, we can't go on like this, can we? We've given them the slip once or twice but sooner or later we're going to have to settle with them.
Oh, I quite agree with you. Running away won't solve our problem. But as soon as we've reached the final decision to stand and fight, there'll be no turning back. It'll either be them or us. Hmm?
Here we are.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara brings drinks.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, my dear, very welcome.
Thanks.
Thank you.
Where's Vicki?
But I thought she was with you?
We are locked in pursuit course.
Calculate destination of enemy time machine.
Report.
The enemy is approaching the planet Mechanus.
Contact Skaro. Report our destination to the Dalek Supreme.
I obey.
Is the reproducer repaired?
We await your orders.
Manufacture will commence at once.
Which of the four humans is to be reproduced?
Their leader, the one they call Doctor. Is the reproducer programmed?
All is in readiness. Photo images and relevant data are in the computer. The humanoid will be completed by the time we arrive at our destination.
Excellent. Commence operations, then assemble at cell renovator chamber.
We obey!
Of course.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Daleks leave and Vicki comes out from behind the door. She fiddles with a communications panel.

Dialogue.Line: Tardis. Hello, Tardis? Come in please. Over. (static) Hello, Tardis. Doctor? Somebody, please help me. Get me out of this. Tardis! Tardis!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She goes to the reproducter where a duplicate of the Doctor is just visible.

Dialogue.Line: It's my fault. All my own stupid fault. I shouldn't have moved the Tardis. I have should have checked up first to make sure that everybody was inside. I shall never forgive myself.
Oh, no Doctor, don't blame yourself. We're all equally to blame. I was convinced she was on board.
Isn't there anything we can do? Is there no way of going back for Vicki?
You don't think I'd be standing here doing nothing do you, if there were? We're helpless, and you of all people should know that the Tardis can't land in the same time and place twice!
We've never stayed long enough in any one place to repair the time mechanism of the Tardis. If we did, is there a chance of going back for Vicki?
Yes, of course, it's possible, but it might take months, even years.
But Doctor, if we all worked together, if Ian and I helped you, surely it's worth a try?
Yes, my dear, I know it's worth a try but you don't think the Daleks are going to sit back and allow us to tinker do you? They're right on our tracks. Their one aim is to destroy.
The Dalek time machine. Of course. Doctor, I've got it. We can't go back for Vicki in the Tardis, but we can in the Daleks own time machine.
Do you mean capture their machine?
Why not?
Well, that would take some doing.
It's the only chance we've got, otherwise we'll never see Vicki again.
If we can only pull it off.
Doctor, we have nothing to lose and now we have even more reason to stop and fight.
What do you say, Doctor?
I say yes. Yes, yes! Our next landing will be our battle ground and we shall fight. We shall fight to the death!
Tardis? Somebody hear me. Tardis! Tardis!
Report position of enemy machine.
It's movement through time is ending.
It is approaching the planet Mechanus.
How long before we reach them?
Er, er, in earth time, er, four minutes.
There is much to do.
Is the humanoid robot complete?
The computer is feeding its memory cells with data.
Physical characteristics are completed. Energy cells fully charged.
Micro-units containing personality and vocal mannerisms are charged.
Prepare to activate. Activate the robot.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki watches as a near-duplicate of the Doctor opens the chamber door.

Dialogue.Line: Ah, looks swampy.
Yes, all to the good, my boy. This sort of terrain is going to make it very difficult for the Daleks.
Yes. Well, we won't have long to explore, Doctor, before the Daleks arrive so lets get moving.
Yes, you are perfectly correct, perfectly correct. However, it doesn't matter about the appearances. It's quite safe to go outside.
Good.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor opens the doors.

Dialogue.Line: Just look at that vegetation.
Yes. Just as though it were alive.
Alive! Yes.

Episodes.Episode: Episode Five - The Death of Doctor Who

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It's a very alien jungle, with giant toadstools quivering.

Dialogue.Line: What is it, Doctor?
Well, I'm not sure, young lady. Is it a plant or some kind of fungus?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor pokes it with his walking stick and it collapses briefly.

Dialogue.Line: Ah! A living fungoid, Doctor.
Yes, I think this is the moment when discretion is the better part of valour. Let's get back into the ship.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But another fungoid is now blocking them.

Dialogue.Line: How did that get there?
They're moving. They're closing in on us!
(Ian hits one) It stings!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There's a bright light.

Dialogue.Line: Well, our friends here obviously don't like the light.
Well, thank goodness for that.
No, but who switched the lights on? Who put them there in the first place?
What does it matter so long as they stay on?
Well, it does suggest that there are other creatures on this planet. Yes, creatures of intelligence.
Hey, come over here! Look. Look, you see? The lights, they form a sort of
Yes!
Corridor.
Yes, its a kind of pattern. Yes, you're quite right, my boy, a corridor.
Doctor, this could be an ideal place to fight those Daleks.
Yes. Yes, well let's follow it. This way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Elsewhere, the Daleks have landed.

Dialogue.Line: This is the planet Mechanus. All forms of life are to be treated as hostile.
Understood. Pass the order. All forms of life to be destroyed on contact.
I obey.
Is the humanoid robot standing by?
It awaits your orders.
Our enemies are moving through the jungle. You are to join them.
Infiltrate, separate and kill. Yes, yes. I understand. Well, the sooner I get started, the sooner I shall accomplish my mission.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Robo-Doc leaves.

Dialogue.Line: We shall follow it as escort. Advise all units.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Daleks trundle off, and Vicki carefully sneaks out of their time machine.

Dialogue.Line: Just a minute.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She's got something in her shoe.

Dialogue.Line: Come along, come along.
All right?
Yep, fine.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Robo-Doc tags along behind them whilst Vicki plays dodge-the-Dalek somewhere else until she is 'captured' by a fungoid which hides her.

Dialogue.Line: We seem to have come to the end of our corridor of lights.
Yes. Let me go first.
Any Daleks?
No, nothing. It's empty.
Let's take a closer look.
Strange place. Now why would anyone construct a complicated system of lights to lead directly to a cave like this?
Well, I'm not quite sure, dear boy, but there must be a reason for it. Yes, like everything else in the universe, there is a reason for it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian puts down the equipment he's been carrying.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, do be careful what you're doing with that.
Hey, over here. Look what I've found.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A long, thin ornate stick or tube.

Dialogue.Line: Well, what do you make of that, Doctor?
Well, I should imagine it's some kind of weapon. Just hold that a minute.
Ah, cha, cha, cha, not so close!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He presses something on the thicker end and the thin end lights up.

Dialogue.Line: Well, that's ingenious, isn't it?
Ah, it's designed to scare off those fungoid things we saw in the swamp.
Very good, my dear, very good.
Well, Doctor, with this and that we are ready for the Daleks. Come on.
She's right, you know.
As they come down the flare path we can pick them off one by one.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There's a noise outside.

Dialogue.Line: Just, just, just, shh, shh, shh. Just a moment now. May I speak? There's something I haven't told you, dear boy. We cannot use this machine in an enclosed area, otherwise we shall all go up in smoke.
But Doctor, the Daleks will find this flare path and we'll be trapped here.
That may be
Let's put the lights out.
Now you're talking common sense. Yes, let's find the cable, shall we?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki has found the Tardis.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor? Doctor, it's me, let me in! It's me!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A fungoid sneaks up on her and she runs away again until she finds the lit path and follows it.

Dialogue.Line: Over here. I've found it.
Good. Where? Ah.
You're quite safe, it's well insulated.
Yeah.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian tries to prise the junction box open.

Dialogue.Line: It's tough.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: On the path, Vicki screams in despair.

Dialogue.Line: There's someone out there!
That noise! That noise, it was it was
Come on, Doctor!
Doctor, that noise! It was
Watch the machine. Watch the machine.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian and the Doctor run out, Robo-Doc pops up and heads to the cave.

Dialogue.Line: The light source has vanished.
Patrols will continue to advance eastward. Perceptors register much movement in that area.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A fungoid covers the Dalek's eye-stalk.

Dialogue.Line: Alert! Alert! Alert!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It gets free and kills the fungoid.

Dialogue.Line: The patrol will continue.
Have I sustained damage.
No. The patrol will continue.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: On the formerly lit path, the Doctor and Ian find the unconscious Vicki.

Dialogue.Line: Vicki! She must have smuggled herself aboard the Daleks time machine. So, they've arrived.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Robo-Doc enters.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor. You were quick.
Oh, was I?
Who was it?
Oh, nobody, I, er
What is it? Where's Ian?
Barbara, my dear, Chesterton is dead.
Dead?
The creatures caught him. I could do nothing.
But, are you sure? Are you certain that he's not just hurt?
Come with me. Perhaps you can help. Come along, come along. Hurry.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian is carrying Vicki.

Dialogue.Line: About another twenty yards, Doctor, I think.
You know Chesterton, they have an extraordinary range of movement, extraordinary.
Yes. All I'm interested in right now is getting into that cave where we'll be safe.
Barbara? Barbara, we've found her. Barbara? Where is she?
Take a look outside, my boy. I'll look after Vicki.
Barbara? Barbara?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki starts to wake.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, come along child, you're all right. Come along. Come along, my dear. Come along.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki pushes him away and tries to run.

Dialogue.Line: My dear girl. What on earth is wrong with you?
No, no, no!
Doctor! She's nowhere to be. Vicki, what is it?
Ian. I thought. When I. Oh, it must be the Doctor or you wouldn't be with him.
What are you saying, Vicki?
I'm sorry I behaved like that, but when I first woke up, I thought you must be the robot.
Robot? My dear, you have haven't got a temperature, have you?
You come and sit down, Vicki.
There is a robot! The Daleks made it exactly like you.
A robot exactly like me?
Every detail. I heard them giving it orders. They made it to infiltrate our group. They told it to infiltrate and kill.
So that's it! This is very serious, Chesterton. Barbara would never have left here unless, unless you or I told her to go.
They've got her. Barbara! Barbara! Barbara!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian dashes out.

Dialogue.Line: You all right, child? Come along!
Is this where you left him?
No.
Oh, come on Doctor, We must find him. You do dawdle so!
Barbara! Barbara!
Ian! He's all right, Doctor. He's all right!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Robo-Doc attacks her with his walking stick. Her screams bring Ian but Robo- Doc elbows him in the stomach and gets away.

Dialogue.Line: What's the matter with him? Why did he try to kill me?
It isn't the Doctor. It's a robot.
A robot?
Yes. A robot the Daleks made. Come on, Barbara, let's, let's find the others.
I can't see any sign of Ian. I think he must have gone further than we thought. Barbara!
Okay, Vicki.
Where's the Doctor?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Enter Doctor and Robo-Doc.

Dialogue.Line: Don't just stand there, Chesterton. That's the robot.
Robot? Robot? Me? You're the imposter. He is the imposter!
Then prove it, my dear fellow, prove it. Then we shall all believe you.
I don't have to.
You mean you can't.
Why, you!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor raises his stick, and Vicki, Barbara and Robo-Doc get out of the way as Ian confronts him.

Dialogue.Line: Put that stick down!
Get out of my way.
And if I won't?
I shall give you the same treatment.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Ian struggle for his walking stick.

Dialogue.Line: Watch him, Chesterton. Watch him!
You still you insist you're the real Doctor?
Oh, what does it matter what I say now.
Chesterton, now's your chance. Destroy it. Destroy it with a rock! Susan, don't look this way, it'll be nasty.
Ian, don't. That's the Doctor!
What?
This is the robot! This is the robot!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian throws the rock at Robo-Doc and misses. The Doctor trips up Robo-Doc then they fence with their walking sticks.

Dialogue.Line: (Dalek tones) Stop! Do not kill!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Robo-Doc freezes, the Doctor reaches in and pulls out wires, killing it.

Dialogue.Line: Hmm, I must get a Doctor.
The enemy time machine. With this in our control, they cannot escape. What is that noise?
Hostile plant life! Destroy! Destroy!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A fungoid covers Dalek 1.

Dialogue.Line: You destroy!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It does.

Dialogue.Line: There is no trace of the humans.
Or the robot?
No. Contact has been lost.
We will organise a full scale search of the jungle at daybreak.
Thing's don't look too good, do they, Doctor.
No, they're not very encouraging, dear boy.
Oh, we've got one consolation. We're all together again.
Yes, but I don't mind admitting, I feel rather exhausted after all that experience.
Why don't you go down and have a rest? Go on. I'll stay out here.
Yes, I don't suppose we can do much in this light.
No. You know it's been dark ever since we landed on this planet.
Yes, well, we'll give it a few hours. It might get lighter. I think I'll take your advice. But I shan't sleep.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The girls are already asleep on the floor when the Doctor lies down. Ian starts to doze too. A metallic lens descends and looks them over before going back up again.
The Doctor is woken by the sunlight.

Dialogue.Line: Chesterton!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian wakes.

Dialogue.Line: Get up, get up, get up!
What's the matter?
Look here!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A white city sits on an elegant array of columns.

Dialogue.Line: I say, you two in there! Come along, wake up, wake up! Come out here quickly!
Wow, beautiful!
Yes. To think that was up there all last night and we never knew.
Quite so. And that is where we've got to get to.
Yes, you bet.
Have you got that thingummybob?
I'll get it.
Come along, come along, let's go. Come on.
Look.
Daleks coming straight for us.
Over there. There's two more of them. Come on, Vicki, quick!
What do we do now?
Well, we must clear this cave as soon as possible, otherwise we can't work that device.
How?
That cliff above, can we climb out that way?
No, it's impossible. Its sheer. They'd pick us off like flies.
It's the only way. What do we do?
I've got it. The Doctor will have to go out there as the robot. He could put them off the scent.
Are you mad?
Why?
The Daleks must know that the robot's dead. They controlled it.
Why? You can't be sure of that.
Anyway, it might confuse them just long enough to enable us to get away.
Look, it would be sheer suicide.
Yeah, perhaps you're right Barbara. Well, Doctor, what? Doctor!
Doctor!
They are trapped in the rock face.
Attack formation! Attack formation! Attack formation! Attack formation! Attack!
Section four will enter the cave. Do not deviate.
We obey.
Section two will circle the cave. Take a position amongst the boulders and cut off any attempt to escape.
We obey.
We will take no prisoners. Eliminate on sight.
We obey.
Move to position. On my command, advance and attack.
Align and advance!
Advance and attack!
Attack and destroy! Destroy and rejoice!

Episodes.Episode: Episode Six- The Planet of Decision

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They all get into the area with the mechonoid and the cave wall closes.

Dialogue.Line: We're going up.
Yeah, it's a lift.
Yes, you got us out of a nasty situation there. I supposed you'd like to know who we are and why we're here?
You're not getting through to him, Doctor, you're not getting through.
Doctor, ask him where he's taking us.
He's taking us up to the city, obviously.
They have escaped. DALEK 2: Not possible. Perceptor readings indicated they were here. DALEK 1: Subject walls to seismic detector tests.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dalek 2 holds out the device.

Dialogue.Line: It is required that we penetrate this wall. Section four will return to the time craft for the electrode unit.
We obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The top of the mechonoid opens and an antenna briefly pops out.

Dialogue.Line: We must have arrived. **[Approach ramp]**

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The mechonoid leads the way out of the lift.

Dialogue.Line: Stop. Follow. follow. VICKI: Look at it! DOCTOR: If's fantastic! BARBARA: I've never seen anything like it. It's huge!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The mechonoid leads the way across a cantilevered walkway.
They meet a second mechonoid, and there is some electronic conversation before it leaves.

Dialogue.Line: English. Enter. Enter. Zero. Stop.
Enter, enter, zero, stop? What does he mean?
It means enter, enter, zero, stop.
(imitates the mechonoid) Tttthhhaaannnk yyyooouuu!
Vicki!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The door slides shut behind them.

Dialogue.Line: What an extraordinary looking thing.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ropes, and a set of stairs.

Dialogue.Line: Ha, looks like a monkey's perch.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They bounce on the bed or couch.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, not bad, eh?
Yes, well I don't like it.
Why not? It's clean, it's comfortable, the robots seem quite friendly.
Yes, yes, robot's. But haven't you noticed something very singular about this place?
Like what?
We've only seen robots. No animal life, human or otherwise.?
That's very true, Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A bearded man comes down the stairs. It's Peter Purves, not playing a comic Alabama hayseed this time.

Dialogue.Line: Stay where you are! You real?
Who are you?
You are real. From Earth?
Yes. Who are you?

From Earth, that couldn't have happened! I worked out the odds. Two thousand to one against. Hey, I supposed they realised I was on my way back when. Well, who won the wars? Look, I'm Steven Taylor. Flight red fifty.
Well, we've learned something. His name.
Yes, Steven Taylor.
Say that again.
Steven Taylor?
Steven Taylor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He throws a small toy panda to Barbara.

Dialogue.Line: That's my mascot, Hi-fi.
Oh! Hi, Fi, I'm Barbara.
I'm Vicki.
Ian Chesterton.
Ian Chesterton.
This is the Doctor.
Well, I'm glad to know you, Steven Taylor.
Well, this is great! I mean, it's ridiculous. I'm lost for words. I thought if ever I met anyone again, I wouldn't stop talking for a week!
Yes, well, you haven't. How long have you been here?
As far as I can make out, about two years.
Two years? Alone?
Well, yes. Apart from those fungus things.
You mean there's no other human beings here on this planet?
No, nothing except the Mechanoids.
Where do they come from, do you know?
You don't know? But this is Mechanus.
Sorry?
Look, about fifty years ago Earth decided to colonise this planet. Well, it landed a rocket full of robots programmed to clear landing sites, get everything ready for the first immigrants.
And they didn't arrive?
No. See, Earth got involved in interplanetary wars. I suppose this place was forgotten.
Fifty years ago? But surely these robots'd be worn out by now. They'd have run down.
No, no, no, no, they're programmed to do their own repairs.
But if you're waiting for people from Earth, well, why not us?
Yes, we could be the immigrants.

You've got to know their code. I've been spending two years trying to break it. Two years. I crashed, you see, out there in the jungle and wandered around for days trying to avoid those fungus things. Of course then the Mechanoids captured me.
Captured? Do you mean you're a prisoner.
Well do you think I'd stay here otherwise? I'm just like you. We're all prisoners. Help yourself to a piece of eternity.
Now, just a minute! There are five of us now. Surely we can do something? We can fight our way out.
Look, at the first sign of violence towards them, the Mechanoids destroy.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Louvres are opened.

Dialogue.Line: Now what's this? What are they playing at?
Yes, I see. We're being held here as specimens.
What, like something in a zoo?
Yes, Vicki. Exactly like a zoo. Only we're the specimens that are on display. Aren't we, my fat little darlings?!
Electrode unit ready.
Operate. Increase power. Conveyor descending.
By taking the humans, the Mechons have forced us to take action against them. We invade.
Skaro reports they have many powerful weapons. We may sustain damage.
The orders of the Dalek Supreme will be obeyed! The humans will be destroyed! The Mechons will not be permitted to stand in our way! We attack! We attack!
Attack! Attack! Attack! Attack! Attack! Attack! Attack!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Daleks get into the lift.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, go away! Leave us alone, can't you?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The louvres shut.

Dialogue.Line: Threat. Stop.
There's only one thing to do to keep yourself sane, that's to make things. I built this.
Did you?
All my own work.
Where does it lead?
Up to the roof.
The roof? Well, why don't we get out that way?
Look, don't think I haven't thought about it myself, but that roof's fifteen hundred feet above ground level.
We've got to get out.
Yes, that's what I thought at first. You'll soon find out you're better off here than out there in the jungle.
We don't give up so easily. We're going to get out of here. The first thing we're going to do is, I'm going to have a look up here.
Look, I'm with you, of course, but what happens when we get down to the ground?
We make our way back to my spaceship.
Your spaceship? Is it serviceable?
I certainly hope so.
But I thought. You see, I assumed you'd crashed.
You coming, Doctor?
Yes, I'm coming, dear boy, I'm coming. Oh, tell me, young man. What happens if these Mechanoids see us up there?
There aren't any. We're allowed to go up here anytime for light, exercise. There are no guards.
Good, good!
Go on, I'll show you.
Splendid.
See? I told you, no guards. I'll go and tell the girls.
Yes, wait a minute, dear boy.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian is standing right on the edge.

Dialogue.Line: Chesterton, be careful!
Yes, I see why the Mechanoids don't mind us coming up here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There are coils of thick cable.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, what do you make of this?
Oh, it's some power aerial, I suppose.
Doctor, I've got it. We can get down to the ground with this.
Yes, yes, if we can break it.
Well, there's a junction box over here. A few good pulls, this'd come away. Come on, let's get the others.
Yes, come along, come along!
Well? Any chance?
Yes, but it's going to be dangerous.
What, do you mean the cable?
Yeah, do you think there's enough?
Maybe. I thought of trying it myself once, but I couldn't have managed it on my own.
Hey, wait a minute. Where's this leading us?
Down to the ground.
We climb down fifteen hundred feet of cable?
I'm not very good on heights.
Yes, it sounds rather risky.
I agree.
The cable's strong. It wouldn't break.
I think it's the only chance we've got.
Well, I don't like it.
Look!
Where are the space travellers?
Zero.
Daleks.
Well, that settles it.
Go on, go on.
On the roof, quick!
Go on! Now, I think we'll leave them something to remember us by.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He switches on his device, grabs his walking stick and goes up the stairs.

Dialogue.Line: You will be annihilated!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Mechonoid is shot, and rolls away.

Dialogue.Line: Dispatch a section to the roof area.
I obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bang! goes the Doctor's device.

Dialogue.Line: Am exterminated! Am exterminated! Argh!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Mechonoid grabs the other Dalek in it's curved arms.

Dialogue.Line: Totally immobilised.
Trapped. Trapped.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The adults pull the cable from the fuse box.

Dialogue.Line: I think we've fused it.
Never mind about that. Let's get on with this. Come along. Quickly! Get that. Come on.
That's all right. There's plenty of it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki is looking down on the trees, and wobbling.

Dialogue.Line: (grabbing her. Vicki! Vicki, come and help us.
We're going to have to lower her.
Vicki Vicki, listen to me. We'll tie the cable round you and lower you to the ground.
No!
You'll be quite safe.
No! I can't.
Vicki, my dear, I'm going to blindfold you. You won't be able to see a thing. You'll be quite safe. Now come along.
I can't. No!
Now come along, child. Pull your self together
Don't! No!
Vicki, come along, come along!
I
Quick, lift up your arms.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He puts the loop of cable around her.

Dialogue.Line: No. No.
Now hold onto this, Vicki.
No I can't.
There, that's it.
Please! I can't!
It's all right.
Please let me out.
Right.
I know you'll be safe. All right?
No, please, let me stay.
Look, let go.
Come along
No no no!
Hold on to this.
No! No!
Okay.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They lower Vicki over the edge.

Dialogue.Line: Good gracious! The place is on fire!
But, Hi-fi! I've got to get the mascot!
No, Steven!
Steven, what are you doing?!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara is almost pulled over the edge. The Doctor and Ian grab her legs.

Dialogue.Line: Get hold of her! What are you doing!
Come back!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Steven dodges a Dalek in the smoke.

Dialogue.Line: Follow Mechonoid. Attack. System.
To defy Daleks is death!
We await commands!
The operation will proceed at once.
Defend. Threat.
They must be destroyed.
Escalate output.
Exterminate them! Exterminate!
Attack here.
Annihilate!
Fire.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Mechonoid's flame thrower is no match for the Daleks, and it goes BOOM. More Mechonoids arrive to grab Daleks and pin them in whilst the smoke gets thicker. Machine versus machine and the Mechanoids are winning.

Dialogue.Line: Vicki. Vicki, are you all right?
Yes. Yes, thanks. How about the others?
They're fine. Now, Vicki, remember the Doctor's device? Well it worked! The city's on fire. Look, you can see!
Vicki, my child, are you all right?
Yes, I'm fine.
Come along, let's get back to the Tardis.
What about Steven? Where is he?
Steven went back to the city.
What for?
We don't know, my child, and his chances of survival in this furnace are utterly...
Quick! That cable's on fire and the whole building's collapsing!
No, we can't!
Halt! You will be exterminated!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian comes out, holding his nose.

Dialogue.Line: Exterminated!
Oh, Ian!
Doctor, it's empty. You've done it again! You've beaten them!
My dear boy, I could kiss you!
Don't waste it on him, kiss me instead!
Oh, I'd be delighted! You know, this must be an extremely advanced machine. Wherever we went, it followed us with such great precision and accuracy. You could travel anywhere in it.
It's huge inside, you know, just like the Tardis.
Of course, my dear, I'd forgotten. You've taken a trip in it.
Shall I show you round?
My dear, I shall be delighted.
After you!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Vicki go inside.

Dialogue.Line: Ian, do you realise we could get home?
Home? Yes. Do you want to?
Yes. I never realised it before.
Neither did I. We may never get another chance.
Do you think we could work it?
Well, would the Doctor take us?
Let's ask him.
Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Clutching Hi-Fi, Steven nearly gets caught by a fungoid.

Dialogue.Line: I don't want to know! I want none of this! I've never heard such nonsense in my life! You'll end up as a couple of burnt cinders, flying around in space. You idiots! You are absolute idiots!
We are not idiots! We want to go home!

Yes, home! I want to sit in a pub and drink a pint of beer again. I want to walk in a park and watch a cricket match. Above all, I want to belong somewhere, do something, instead of this aimless drifting around in space.
Aimless? I've tried for two years to get you both home!
Well, you haven't been very successful, have you?
How dare you, young man. How dare you, sir! I didn't even invite you into the ship in the first place. You both thrust yourselves upon me!
Oh, Doctor, stop it!
Oh, for heavens sake, I've never heard such nonsense.

Look, I know we thrust ourselves upon you, but we've through a great deal together since then. And all we've been through will remain with us always. It'll probably be the most exciting part of my life. Look, Doctor, we're different people, and now we have a chance to go home. We want to take that chance. Will you help us work that machine?
No! No! I will not aid and abet suicide.
Oh, he's as stubborn as a mule.
Doctor? Doctor, you've got to let them go if they want to. They want to be back in their own time.
Don't you want to go with them, child?
What for? What would I want to be back in their time for? I want to be with you. Doctor, you've got to help them.
Don't you realise, child, the enormous risks?
But it's up to them.
Do you both realise the enormous risks?
We do. We still want to go.
Please, Doctor.
Very well, follow me. But you must follow my instructions implicitly, understood? Implicitly! You will both have about a fifty-fifty chance. Follow me, come along.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Later, Vicki and the Doctor come out, and the Dalek machine dematerialises.
Ian comes out of a garage near a tube station. The car tax disc expiry date is December 1965.

Dialogue.Line: Barbara, we made it.
I don't believe it!
London 1965!
Hey, we're two years out.
Oh, what's two years amongst friends? We're home! I'll just go and press that button.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He goes inside and something starts beeping.

Dialogue.Line: Run!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: KaBOOM!

Dialogue.Line: Well, that's put paid to the Dalek's time travelling for a while.
It'll give the Doctor a breather anyway.
Yes. I wonder where he is right now?
Hey, Doctor, wherever you are.
Shh! There's someone coming.
Goodbye, Doctor! Thanks for the ride!
It was fun, Doctor! Goodbye!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A series of stills to show our two explorers getting reacquainted with the Capital - Trafalgar Square and the pigeons, the Embankment, a blue Police Box, Regent Street.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, I enjoyed that.
Yes, so did I.
Fares please.
Oh, it's great to be back. Nothing seems to have changed.
Oh, you wait till we get back to Coal Hill. Hey!
Any more fares please?
How are we going to explain our absence?
Yeah, that's a point, isn't it? We'll have to think of something. It had better be good, eh?
Fares please.
Oh, er, two three's, please.
Two three's? You must be joking. Where've you been? On the Moon?
Er, no, but you're getting warm.
Shh!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: On the Visualiser, Ian and Barbara burst into laughter.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, they made it! They made it!
I shall miss them. Yes, I shall miss them, silly old fusspots. Come along, my dear, it's time we were off.
